listing.short_description:
A superior detached home on one of Ickenhams finest roads. The property requires full modernisation offering the opportunity to transform into a perfect family home.

Directions

Leaving our Ickenham office, turn left onto Swakeleys Road, just before the zebra crossing. The Avenue is situated off the second lay by on the left hand side.

Situation

The Avenue is an exclusive tree lined private residential road that is regarded as one of Ickenham's most prestigious and sought after locations known for its grand houses with open and spacious gardens. It is a short stroll to the village shops, restaurants and Metropolitan / Piccadilly line train station with direct links to The City and Baker Street, while London and the Home Counties are easily accessed via the A40. A number of highly regarded schools are within close proximity including Breakspear Primary & Vyners Senior School. To the end of the road is Ickenham Tennis Courts and the award winning Swakeleys Park, which has been recently renovated and enjoys beautiful scenery and woodland areas.

Description

An exceptionally attractive four bedroom detached house situated in one of Ickenham's most sought after roads. Requiring complete modernisation throughout, this characterful property offers abundant opportunities to create a stunning family home. The accommodation is entered via a spacious reception hall, through which there are doors to the two separate reception rooms, leading on from one of the reception rooms is the kitchen which is located to the read of the property. Additionally to the ground floor there is a guest cloakroom. The first floor offers four good sized bedrooms and a bathroom. The property requires full refurbishment throughout.

Outside

There is a large front garden mostly laid to lawn, and a driveway providing off-street parking for two/three vehicles. To the rear of the property there is a good sized garden, mostly laid to lawn with many mature trees providing immense privacy.

listing.description: Exceptionally rare opportunity - must be viewed to be fully appreciated! Located on a desirable road and offering over 2600 sqft of impressive accommodation is this truly superb and unique five bedroom house, on the market for the first time in 35 years.The property requires modernisation, however, it is perfectly suitable for someone to move into and gradually improve over time. There are a host of original features throughout including ceiling roses, cornicing and fireplaces. The spacious accommodation comprises entrance hall with WC, 17' reception room with bay window, a further reception room currently used as a library, kitchen with Aga, utility room, two large storage cupboards and access to the cellar. To the first floor there are three generous double bedrooms and a family bathroom. On the second floor there are a further two double bedrooms, kitchen area, bathroom and eaves storage. This floor would be perfect for families with older children wanting their own space or even a live in au pair.To the rear there is a good sized garden which is bisected by a stream; the fore being mainly laid to lawn and the rear a haven for wildlife. To the front there is off street parking and access to the garage. There is also further potential to extend to the side and rear (stp).The location is quite simply superb. Chislehurst train station is just a few minutes' walk away and offers regular services to Lewisham (for DLR), Central London and The City. Local shops can be found just at the end of the road on Chislehurst Road and there are many fine public houses and restaurants within walking distance. Some of the area's finest schools are nearby including the highly regarded Bullers Wood School for Girls.In our opinion this really is a one of a kind property which offers tremendous potential and should be viewed at your earliest opportunity.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A unique opportunity to purchase a substantial detached property with need of some modernisation and possible extension. The house has three floors and can be rearranged to create a lovely family property.The house has a lobby leading to a spacious hallway leading to a sitting room and family room. The current conservatory could be converted to a kitchen. Stairs leading to a half landing which has a cloakroom. The first floor has three bedrooms and a kitchen (which could be converted back to a bedroom) and a family bathroom. The second floor has a spacious bedroom with deep eaves cupboards and a shower room.SituationSouthdown Road is well located being just off Worple Road which links Wimbledon Town centre with Raynes Park. The property is well positioned for 2 mainline stations and Wimbledon tube. Raynes Park is the closest shopping centre with a large Waitrose and many other useful shops and amenities.OutsideTo the side of the property is a driveway providing parking for several cars. This area leads to a detached garage and gate leading to the rear garden. The garden has a lawn and mature shrubs and bushes.

listing.short_description:
This detached 4 bedroom, 3 reception room, 2 bathroom family home is set on a substantial plot backing onto Aldenham Country Park. Located within Greenbelt Countryside, the property offers an abundance of character features including ornate cornicing, décor panelling, timber frames, a large cast iron fireplace and more. The Lodge also benefits from spacious accommodation comprising, a grand reception room, large triple aspect kitchen/diner and a delightful rear conservatory. The exterior features a wide approx 130ft garden, a detached garage and a shared driveway. Located close to Elstree Village, several outstanding schools, the A1 and motorway links, as well as walking distance to Elstree and Borehamwood Train Station and Borehamwood Town Centre, this unique property would make an extraordinary family home. Elstree Hill Lodge was built circa 1890 as a former gate lodge to Aldenham House (now Haberdashers' Aske's Boys School). Available for sale for the first time in over 30 years, this unique two storey Tudor Style red brick building was once occupied by Lord Aldenham and is regarded as of local importance, is considered of architectural interest, and appears on the adopted List of Locally Important Buildings in Hertsmere (Hertsmere Borough Council, July 2009).

listing.description: No. 84 Hare Lane is one of a pair of elegant halls adjoining Edwardian family homes which have undergone a full programme of modernisation; with restoration and refurbishment from the ground up, the property provides a luxuriously appointed house in a ready to move in state – just add furniture and personal belongings to feel immediately at home! On the first floor are two large double bedrooms and a generous single with an oriel bay window. The family bathroom includes a large over bath rain shower, vanity basin and low level wc, finished to an exemplary standard with stylish floor and wall tiling. On the top floor is the master suite, with useful eaves storage accessed from the landing. This large l-shaped bedroom benefits from a luxurious en-suite shower room. Outside off road parking is available for two cars and the rear garden is fully enclosed with new fencing and a useful side access. The developer has paid tremendous attention to detail combining period style features such as high ceilings with cornicing, parquet flooring and elegant bathroom fitments, with the latest in contemporary lighting, double glazed ‘heritage style’ windows as well as underfloor heating in the kitchen. A canopied entrance porch leads into the generous reception hall, with a wide easy rising staircase to the first floor. A cloak room with tiled flooring and a concealed utility area in an under stairs storage cupboard are accessed from the hall.The high ceilinged living room has a bright easterly aspect through a bay window, it also features a stylish fireplace, spotlighting and parquet flooring. The expansive Kitchen/Family room has zoned areas including a sitting area with a fireplace recess and built in storage to either side of the chimney breast. The fitted shaker style kitchen has built in appliances and an island unit/breakfast bar; the dining area is set under a skylight which floods the room with light and the whole room is completed with bi-fold doors opening onto the south west facing garden.

listing.description: A stunning six bedroom detached executive home situated that has been modernised by the current owners to now provide stunning living accommodation.The versatile accommodation comprises a spacious entrance hall with marble flooring; living room with feature marble fireplace and views over the rear garden; family room ideal for relaxing and entertaining again with views over the rear garden; dining room/study; modern kitchen/breakfast room with granite worktops and fitted high quality appliances, such as a hob, oven, coffee machine, microwave and designer angled extractor hood. The kitchen also holds space for American style fridge/freezer, bay fronted window, door leading to the side of the property, large granite breakfast bar, sensor lighting, fridge, wine-cooler, French doors leading onto the garden, inset granite sink.The first floor benefits from a large master suite with a spacious four piece en suite luxury bathroom with underfloor heating; the second bedroom has an en suite shower room, the third bedroom also benefits an en suite bathroom, which leads to a bonus storage or laundry room. In addition to this are three further bedrooms and the separate shower room.There is also an extensive driveway parking leading to the secure integral double garage and a beatifically presented southern facing garden ideal for entertaining. Furthermore the property can be accessed by rear vehicle access from Clarewood Drive. It is situated within walking distance of Camberley Town centre ideal for the train links, shopping complex and restaurants.

Situated on the North Side of Southdown Road within a short walk of Raynes Park Station and shops. The area is particularly well served with schools. The property also offers scope for redevelopment, subject to planning.

listing.description: Randalls Residential Estate Agents. The west wing of a Grade II Listed Victorian country house enjoying a peaceful location and requiring some modernisation with lovely gardens and a paddock. 5 bedrooms, 3 reception rooms and large cellar. In all, about 3.47 acres.Reception hall, drawing room, dining room, study, kitchen, utility/cloakroom, full size cellar with 6 rooms, 5 bedrooms, family bathroom, detached studio, garage, delightful and extensive gardens, paddock, in all about 3.47 acres.Basingstoke 9 miles (Waterloo from 45 mins)Reading 11 miles (Paddington from 26 mins)SituationThe property is approached over a private drive on the edge of Silchester, a popular village located on the Hampshire/Berkshire borders. The village has facilities including a primary school, public house and church, whilst more day to day facilities are available in the nearby town of Tadley. More extensive leisure, recreational and educational facilities are available in the nearby towns of Reading, Newbury and Basingstoke, each within a short drive, and consequently the property is well located for access to both the Paddington and Waterloo lines and the M3 and M4 motorways.The village itself is the site of the Roman town Calleva Atrebatum and is surrounded by delightful heathland and woods with extensive walks and rides available through ancient Pamber Forest and over the Englefield Estate woods (by subscription).The PropertySilchester Hall was formerly part of the nearby Stratfield Saye estate and was built for the daughter of the Duke of Wellington and enjoys an excellent position right on the edge of the village. West Silchester Hall comprises the west wing of the building and includes the extensive basement which has brick barrel vaulted ceilings and which predate the building of the hall itself. The property retains much of its original character. It has been within the same ownership for over 50 years and now requires some modernisation.On the ground floor, the front door opens to the reception hall from which staircases rise to the first floor and descend to the basement. The dual aspect drawing room has an open fireplace and the dining room has French doors opening to the rear garden and there is a study. The kitchen has a range of wooden units and a dresser and has a door opening to the front garden. There is a utility/cloakroom.On the first floor, there are five bedrooms and the family bathroom.For further information, please refer to the floorplan.OutsideThe property is approached over a private gravelled driveway from the Bramley Road. There is a ample parking and a detached garage with adjoining garden store and an artist’s studio which offers scope for various uses, subject to the appropriate planning consent.The gardens are delightful, extending to about 1.28 acres and provide the most perfect setting for the property. Featured in the National Garden Scheme they were described as ‘a much loved garden full of fascinating colour combinations, with many spectacular herbaceous borders filled with rare and unusual plants. Pots with half hardies, a wild garden with orchids surrounding a pond, banks of rhododendrons and a kitchen garden’. There are also expanses of lawn, including a disused grass tennis court and an adjoining paddock.In all, the grounds extend to about 3.47 acres.ServicesMains water and electricity. Private drainage. Oil central heatingLocal AuthorityBasingstoke and Deane Borough Council. T: ViewingStrictly by appointment through Randalls Residential on Directions RG7 2LXFrom central Silchester, turn opposite the Calleva Arms pub into Holly Lane. After a short distance take the first left turning into Bramley Road. The driveway to Silchester Hall is on the right, opposite the turning to Whistlers Lane. Bear right to West Silchester Hall.

listing.description: We are delighted to offer for sale this very well presented and thoughtfully modernised semi detached family home, situated in a highly sought after road in central Twickenham, offering easy access to the town centre and a short walk into Strawberry Hill village.The accommodation now offers a separate front reception room, good size open plan kitchen/family room, utility room and WC to the ground floor, whilst the upper two floors provide, three double bedrooms, a fourth single bedroom and two bathrooms.Further benefits include a well maintained south facing rear garden with a detached home office/garden room, private front garden and potential for further extension to the ground floor (stpp).There are good transports links in the area, with Twickenham station a short walk away and regular buses into Richmond (District line tube), Teddington and Kingston. And a short drive to the M3, with good access to the M25 and M4. The local area is well served for schools, both private and state-run.To arrange an appointment to view, please call the vendors’ Sole agents Chase Buchanan.

listing.description: Walnut Farm House, Bramdean, Alresford, Hampshire SO24 0LWAlresford 5 milesPetersfield 9 miles (mainline station London Waterloo and access A3)Winchester 11 miles (mainline station and access M3)Southampton Airport 19 milesIn the centre of the village, within the South Downs National Park, an exceptionally fine Grade II period house, late 15th Century origins, extensively renovated and beautifully proportioned accommodation, overlooking private courtyards and gardensReception/Dining HallDrawing RoomSitting RoomPlayroomKitchen/Breakfast RoomUtility/Secondary kitchenCloakroomLaundry Room5/6 Bedrooms3 BathroomsAmple Off Street ParkingOutbuildingHome Office/Studio and Store/Boot RoomEast and West Facing CourtyardsSummerhouseGarden ShedGreenhouseWendy HouseKitchen GardenPrivate Well Stocked GardensAbout 0.580 acres (0.235 hectares)The LocationWalnut Farm House lies in the centre of the village of Bramdean, which is situated in the South Downs National Park, midway between Chichester, Winchester and Petersfield and is surrounded by attractive rolling farmland and downland. In the village there is a garage which has a small shop, the Fox Inn and a Norman church. The A272, which runs through the village, provides a direct link to the Cathedral city of Winchester which has many excellent amenities including a mainline station to London Waterloo and access on to the M3 north to London or south to the M27 coastal motorway and the ferry ports. To the east, Petersfield has good shopping facilities and access on to the A3 and within a short drive the A272 joins the A32 at the West Meon Hut which also provides fast access to several large towns including Alton, Fareham, Southampton and Portsmouth.The PropertyWalnut Farm House is a classic Grade II listed timber framed building that has evolved from the late 15th century through to the 19th century. The timber frame has wattle and daub partly enclosed in brick, partly tile hung under an old plain tiled roof. The house has been comprehensively restored and refurbished to an exceptionally high standard, but working very closely with the Listed Building Officer to retain all of its inherent character. Features include fireplaces, panelling, engineered oak and tiled floors.The extensive accommodation extends to some 3778 sq ft. The main rooms are all beautifully proportioned. The front door opens into a central reception/dining hall, at either end are the drawing room and sitting room and in the north eastern wing, the kitchen laundry room, a cloakroom, study/family room and a secondary kitchen. The main staircase leads up to four bedrooms and two bathrooms, and in the wing there are two further bedrooms and a bathroom, and this has an exterior staircase so could be used as a potential self contained annexe with some minor work carried out.OutsideThe main drive lies on the western side, it has a pair of five bar gates, provides ample parking and space for garaging, subject to planning. On the eastern side the farmhouse has the benefit of a further parking space and double gates leads through into one of the courtyards.The GardensOn ether side of the house are walled courtyards. On one side an outbuilding used as a home office/studio and store/boot room. The west facing courtyard has a paved terrace, pergola smothered in roses, lawn, various shrubs and a pear tree. The main gardens are divided by low brick walls and steps with terraced lawns, beds enclosed by box hedging. There is a beech tree, walnut tree, summerhouse, garden shed, and a gated entrance through to a kitchen garden with greenhouse and Wendy house.The gardens extend to about 0.580 acres (0.235 hectares)agent’s note:  A number of fixtures and fittings are expressly excluded from the sale. A full and comprehensive inventory is available for inspection through the offices of the joint agents.Services  Mains water and electricity. Private drainage lpg gas.Local authority information  Winchester City Council

listing.description: SummaryLocated in a quiet private cul-de-sac in Whetstone is this five bedroom detached family home. This home benefits from two large reception rooms, double garage and modern fitted kitchen.DescriptionDating back to the 15th Century, Whetstone originated in medieval times, and legend has it that the name stems from the stone that is placed outside of the Griffin Pub, where soldiers went to sharpen their swords before the Battle of Barnet. Whetstone is perfect for both commuters and families alike. Located in zone 4, Totteridge and Whetstone northern line tube station offers easy access in and out of the city and central London, whilst also being only moments away from open countryside.Whetstone offers a vast range of architecture from period apartments boasting plenty of character, to large 1920's and 1930's houses, perfect for a growing family. Parts of Whetstone have benefited from modernisation in recent years, which have given rise to some luxury new builds that have incorporated the Help to buy scheme.In the centre of Whetstone is located the ever popular high street. Known for its range of cafes, restaurants and gastro-pubs, it was voted the Evening Standards healthiest high street of 2015. The surrounding area also benefits from a variety of fantastic local facilities, such as the South Herts golf club, the Totteridge tennis club and the All Saints Arts Centre. listing.description: Elegant Three/Four Bedroom Period Home With Beautiful Finish.Period features and contemporary ingenuity marry perfectly in this elegant three/four bedroom period home. Generously arranged over three picture perfect floors, the property is superbly presented and beautifully arranged. Those Venetian plastered walls are simply divine! Further treats include six period fireplaces, original shutters, high ceilings and a lovely, secluded rear garden. The accommodation comprises two/three superb reception rooms, three/four double bedrooms, a bright, modern kitchen, bountiful bathroom and a guest wc. The property backs onto the very lovely Brunswick Park which enjoys a new play area. The new cafe is perfect for a weekend natter while the kids run amok. Camberwell boasts a healthy array of culinary attractions - best watch those waist lines! Transport is a cinch with nearby Denmark Hill and Oval and Elephant and Castle Tube a short bus ride.The raised ground floor entrance welcomes us through a walled front garden. Head up white painted steps to the front door. The entrance hall is bright and inviting and really has the wow-factor with those stunning Venetian plastered walls - they're so touchable! The original timber floors have been sanded and varnished and there is a rather grand staircase directly ahead. A step to the right reveals the first reception which boasts a magnificent sash bay with period shutters, superb (working) fireplace and marble mantel. A further reception comes next with another impressive fireplace and some calming rear leafy views. Currently used as a study the space could easily be used as a fourth bedroom. Back through the hall you'll find a handy guest wc with eco-loo. At the end of the hall you find an impressive family bathroom with fabulous walk-in shower, loo, heated towel rail and pretty roll top bath. Underfloor heating keeps the toes snug. Crisp white wooden panelling and royal blue walls finish it all off perfectly.Moving to the lower ground floor you'll meet a wonderful double reception that stretches the full length of the main footprint. There's a front aspect bay of sash windows and rear French doors. To the front there is a fireplace with a tasty art nouveau style mantel while the rear of the room has a striking original cast iron Victorian range with exposed brick feature wall. The hallway offers a further front access point with fitted security gate and recessed storage area — perfect for bikes and bins! Your kitchen is a real joy with chunky, solid oak worktops and five ring gas hob. The boiler was only fitted last year meaning you don't have to! An airy environment is guaranteed by a large side aspect casement window and further double glass doors leading to the patio. The garden itself is a delight! Leafy and peaceful and backing onto the very lovely Brunswick Park. It's full of mature shrubs, a well presented artificial lawn and scampering squirrels.The first floor plays host to three further double bedrooms. Spanning the entire width of the house the master enjoys a bright appointment with two impressive sash windows. There is an enchanting decorative fireplace flanked on either side by handsome fitted wooden wardrobes. Bedroom two also offers a period fireplace, fitted wardrobes and original cornicing. Bedroom three faces rear with lofty views over the enchanting south facing garden and Brunswick Park. The lower ceiling is made seamless with the inclusion of an overhead Velux installed while modernising the roof above.Take a 13 minute stroll up the very lovely Camberwell Grove to Denmark Hill station where you can pick up fast services to Victoria, Elephant and Castle, and Blackfriars. The London Overground line offers unbeatable links to Clapham, Shoreditch and Canary Wharf (via Canada Water). Any number of buses travelling through Camberwell will whizz you into the West End or City around the clock. There many excellent primary schools nearby rated Ofsted outstanding /good: Lyndhurst Primary, St John the Divine, Brunswick Park, Crawford Primary and the The Villa pre-preparatory and nursery school. James Allen Girls School, Alleyns and Dulwich College are also a short drive away and are renowned as some of the best independent secondary schools in the country.Camberwell is fast becoming a foodie's dream! We love 'Fladda and Theos', The Crooked Well for some refined pub grub and The Camberwell Arms, is wowing folk with it's innovative gastro food. Those looking to wash it all down with a nice pint are spoilt with TheTiger providing a vast array of ale and beer. For a more traditional experience hop over the road to The Hermit's Cave for a pint of the black stuff by the fire. Brunswick Park is right on your doorstep for when the sun is shining. It's gorgeous, family-friendly and has that new children's playground, lush picnic area, tennis courts and a multi-use games area. It's a fantastic spot to walk the dog. It also holds a number of family-friendly events throughout the year: Annual Fete, Easter Egg Hunt, "Scrufts" Dog Show to name but a few. A great community asset to have on your doorstep!

listing.description: Randalls Residential Estate Agents. A charming detached Listed period home offered in excellent order standing in lovely gardens in the centre of this popular village. 4 bedrooms, 3 reception rooms and large garden with double garage. Within catchment of The Priory SchoolReception hall, sitting room, dining room, study, kitchen/breakfast room, utility room, cloakroom, master bedroom with en suite, three further bedrooms, family bathroom, shower room, double garage with room above, lovely gardens.Basingstoke 4 milesNewbury 14 milesReading 14 milesSituationYew Tree House is located in the centre of Monk Sherborne, a very sought after and quiet village located just to the north of Basingstoke. Within the village there is a church and a pub and it falls within the catchment area of the highly regarded Priory primary school located in a neighbouring village. Basingstoke offers a comprehensive range of leisure, recreational and education needs.Commuting is excellent with Junction 6 of the M3 being within a short drive at Basingstoke, and with the mainline station in Basingstoke providing fast and frequent services to London Waterloo from 45 minutes.The propertyYew Tree House is an attractive detached period house, Grade II Listed, believed to date from the 15th Century with later additions. Of oak framed construction with brick infills under a clay tiled roof, the property offers comfortable and modernised accommodation in excellent order throughout, extending to about 2,382 sq.Ft, and retains a number of period features including exposed timbers and brickwork, open fireplaces and an original copper.On the ground floor, the front door opens to the reception hall from which the stairs rises to the first floor, with door opening to the rear garden. The triple aspect sitting room has an open fireplace and sliding patio doors opening to the rear terrace. The dining room has a fireplace with fitted log burner and exposed brickwork to one wall. The kitchen has been replaced by the current owners and is luxuriously appointed with a comprehensive range of units with a central island and breakfast bar and granite worksurfaces and opens to the breakfast room. There is also a utility room, study and cloakroom.On the first floor, the mater bedroom has views over the back garden to fields beyond, and has an en-suite shower room. There are three further bedrooms, one with a useful adjoining attic room, and the family bathroom and an additional shower roomFor further details please refer to the floorplan.OutsideThe property is set back from the lane behind a mature hedge and is approached over a gated gravel driveway which provides ample parking and which leads to the detached brick built double garage which has a room above.The gardens extend to about 0.4 acre. These are level and fully enclosed by a combination of mature hedging and fencing and offer a high degree of privacy. Primarily to lawn, there are a number of mature trees and bushes and various flower and shrub beds and borders. There is a paved terrace to the rear accessed from the sitting room. Greenhouse.ServicesMains water, drainage and electricity. Oil central heating.Local authorityBasingstoke and Deane Borough CouncilViewingBy prior appointment through Randalls Residential on Directions to RG26 5HRFrom Basingstoke take the A339 signed to Kingsclere and Newbury. After about 1½ miles turn right signposted to Monk Sherborne, shortly after the Stone Masons. On entering the village turn left at the war memorial and Yew Tree House will be found on the right hand side after a short diatance, just before the telephone box.

listing.description: Detailed DescriptionFour bedroom double bay-fronted, Victorian semi-detached family home, in a premier location, positioned off Wanstead High Street.Lovingly occupied for a number of years as a family home, this delightful property now requires some modernisation. Retaining a host of period features, this is a fantastic opportunity for discerning purchasers to mastermind the perfect family home.The house is approached by a driveway with off-street parking for at least three vehicles. Internally the accommodation is arranged over two floors; The ground floor comprising a bay-fronted living room with feature fireplace, part open-plan to the dining room with matching fireplace and stripped wooden floorboards throughout. There is a third reception room to the rear of the ground floor and a separate kitchen. There is a garage which can be accessed from the garden and a full-width cellar. The first floor hosts four bedrooms all of which are a good size and a family bathroom.To the rear is a delightful, mature garden, with a large patio and pathway which leads to a studio towards the back of the garden. There is potential for a rear extension as others have done in the street, subject to the usual planning consents.Cambridge Road is well located for local amenities and the main High Street, which boasts a comprehensive selection of cafes, boutique shops, pubs and restaurants. Transport links into London are excellent with Wanstead underground (Central Line) the nearest station. There are several well regarded state and private schools within easy reach.
listing.short_description: Four bedroom double bay-fronted, Victorian semi-detached family home, in a premier location, positioned off Wanstead High Street. Lovingly occupied for a number of years as a family home, this delightful property now requires some modernisation

listing.description: A unique opportunity to acquire a chain free detached family home with enormous potential for extension and improvement (subject to the necessary consents) on a generous south facing plot in one of High Barnet's most sought after turnings being within walking distance of the town centre as well as highly regarded local schools and transport facilities including the Northern Line underground. The property is also on the fringes of Old Fold Manor golf course and a short walk of picturesque Hadley Green. The accommodation does require modernisation throughout with the ground floor consisting of a welcoming square hallway, an exceptionally spacious, quadruple aspect open plan reception area consisting of lounge and dining area divided by a bar, a kitchen/ breakfast room and utility area as well as a guest WC. To the first floor, there are 3 double bedrooms with an en suite bathroom to the master and a family bathroom. There is also a sizeable loft room which could also potentially be converted. listing.description: Situated on the edge of the popular village of fairwarp with 2 1/2 acres of land and direct access onto the ashdown forest. A 3/4 bedroom detached house, benefiting from stables, a 2 acre paddock, an indoor pool and detached garage. Whilst this property is in need of modernisation, it's location and outlook make it a must view. Call .We are delighted to offer to market, this four bedroom detached family home, situated on the edge of the village of Fairwarp. Built in the 1960s and having never before been on the market, Seely Cottage is very unique. The split level property is laid out over four/five floors, and has over 3500sq ft of accommodation. The entrance level approached via the driveway from the gate, has a good size entrance hall with cloakroom and separate w.C. A kitchen, dining room and utility room with a separate entrance. The second floor, which is split level, has a large open living room, with open fire and access onto the roof terrace with stunning views over the property's 2.5 acres of paddock and onto the Ashdown Forest beyond. Just off of the living room is the fourth bedroom and then above are bedrooms one and two, both doubles and one with an en suite as well as the family bathroom. From the entrance, down half a level to the lower ground is a further suite of bedrooms with a family bathroom and a private and secluded area of the garden adjacent. Currently as a self contained one bedroom flat with living room with sleeping recess, double bedroom, family bathroom and kitchenette/dining area. This was formerly the children’s bedrooms and play room. In addition there is a self contained indoor swimming pool on this level with direct access to the garden.The well ventilated basement (down another half level) has an additional garden access, as well as a window. It is large enough for extensive storage and currently holds the swimming pool plant and boiler. It was once a recreation area. Outside there is off road parking for up to four cars and a double length garage. The formal, wrap around gardens are mainly laid to lawn with natural hedges to give you privacy whilst in the garden. There are two stables and a tack room, leading onto a small concrete yard, which has access onto the two acre paddock. Seely Cottage benefits from having two riding licences and direct access onto the Ashdown Forest. Viewing is considered essential to fully appreciate all this property has to offer. Location: Seely Cottage is situated in a lovely secluded, tucked away, yet not isolated rural location within the Ashdown Forest and a short walk from the centre of the pretty village with its village green and public house. There is a local shop for everyday needs at the end of Straight Half Mile, whilst the larger town of Uckfield with its wider range of shopping facilities including two supermarkets, schooling for all ages and mainline railway station with commuter links to London is about three miles distant.Directions: From our office in Uckfield high street, proceed north out of town, through Ringles Cross until reaching the roundabout. Proceed through Maresfield, along Straight Half mile and turn right on to the B2026. Proceed until the signpost for Fairwarp village. Continue through the village passing the public house on the left and on exiting Fairwarp, turn left into the forest track directly after the 40 mile an hour speed sign. Seely Cottage will be found at the end of the track.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

The rear garden is a particular feature, being circa 150ft in length. More comprehensive facilities are available in nearby Cambridge together with an excellent choice of state and independent schools for all ages. The world renowned Addenbrookes' Hospital/Biomedical Campus is 3.5 miles away and The Babraham Institute and Granta Park are both within 7 miles.Commuters are well served by road or rail with the nearby A11 linking with the M11 for access to Stansted Airport and the M25. There are mainline railway stations providing access to King's Cross and Liverpool Street at Cambridge, Whittlesford and Audley End.

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: A stunning period property presented in excellent condition and offering some very striking features throughout both floors. The most recent alteration is particularly impressive, encompassing an extended kitchen-breakfast room, built to an excellent specification that creates a social hub for all seasons. Ample light floods through the room between bi-folding doors and Velux windows built into the vaulted ceiling. Comprehensively fitted to include integrated appliances, quartz work-tops, LED down-lighting and under-floor heating. A five-burner hob, extractor hood, double oven (including a microwave oven), washing machine, dishwasher and dryer are all included.The original architecture and remaining accommodation is equally impressive, displaying many original features such as detailed coving, fireplaces and high ceilings throughout. The bay fronted elevations are evident on both floors and where windows are replaced, sash style units are have been replicated. Three generous reception rooms provide excellent space for entertaining and family requirements and the chimneys remain open for burning solid fuel as required. Interestingly, the family room still retains an antique cast iron "range" (not in use), complete with the original tools. This will remain in the property.The entrance hall is also well-proportioned, with a w.C and staircase leading to the first floor. Four bedrooms, all of which house fireplaces - and a family bathroom suite complete the picture.

listing.description: This unique, four-bedroom Edwardian house was built at the height of the Arts and Craft movement in 1908, on Woodlands Avenue in Wanstead. In recent years, the house has been modernised, with the addition of a copper-clad extension to the top floor, and an entire interior refurbishment by architectural designer, Leo Bachmann. Accommodation extends to 1,715 sq ft, overlooking an expansive back garden, a short distance from Wanstead Tube station.Now, the house embodies an honesty and integrity in materials synonymous with the doctrines of John Ruskin, William Morris and Augustus Pugin. It also exhibits refined instances of contemporary design, as seen in the master bedroom, which elegantly utilises the extended space to create an elevated sleeping quarters, with views over substantial gardens below and the treetops of Wansted Flats beyond.The front elevation of the house blends in seamlessly with its neighbours on Woodlands Avenue, a peaceful residential street. In terms of volume and configuration, this is as far the similarities extend. Beyond the entrance hall, Leo Bachmann has sought to create a series of spaces that flow seamlessly together, naturally emphasising the flow of natural light in his use of neutral tones and wood, from the rear of the house, right through to the original bay window at the front. A contemporary kitchen occupies this space in the house and has an island in arabescato marble, an original hearth and a built-in pine dresser. The dresser and cabinetry have been washed in Swedish floor soap, naturally dying the grain. Natural tones of Earthborn claypaint have been used throughout the house.Pine boards, treated with the same Swedish wash, run across the remainder of this floor, connecting the kitchen aesthetically to a dining area with original Edwardian fireplace and a hearth of quarry tiles. There is also a highly practical boot room and utility area with a butler sink and plenty of storage space. Beyond, is a newly-created living room, with a glazed roof and window seat with views out over garden. This area of the house has been insulated with Welsh wool.The garden is arguably one the house’s most attractive properties. It is south-facing, approximately fifty metres in length and has a paved patio space for outside dining. A mature bay tree is positioned to one side of this space, which produces wonderfully fragrant leaves for cooking. There is also a storage shed at the farthest end, as well as side access.The first floor is occupied by three bedrooms and a family bathroom with Graphenstone polished plaster. One of the bedrooms is currently arranged as a nursery and has a large bay window at the front of the house. Another is used as a study and has an original Edwardian tiled fireplace and re-claimed cast iron radiators, in addition to a beautifully curved wall. Original pine floorboards run across this level, which have also been organically washed.The second storey is occupied by the master bedroom suite. Exposed brickwork on the stairway leads up to a wonderfully bright space with a Juliet balcony at the rear offering wonderful views of the surrounding countryside, including the garden in the foreground, Wansted Flats in the distance and Epping Forest beyond. Panels of glazing in the ceiling also draw in light from above. The woodwork on this floor is Douglas Fir and extends to the en-suite bathroom which is partially open-plan, concealing a shower, bath and dressing area.The ethos of the Arts and Crafts movement is often viewed in opposition to the machine-friendly outlook of Modernism. However, both movements championed a truth and integrity in materials, while they may have deployed different design principles in service of their beliefs. This house embodies the best of both schools of thought, seeking to unify the old with the new in a tonally warm and earthy set of spaces which champion their materials, while emphasising space, light and the verdant surroundings, outside the walls of house.The house is excellently positioned for the shops, cafes and restaurants of Wanstead village. It is also within the catchment area of Alderbrook Primary school which was recently rated ‘outstanding’ by Ofsted.Green spaces abound. Wanstead Forest park, renowned locally for its carpet of bluebells, is positioned at the end of Woodlands Avenue, a two-minute walk from the house. Wanstead Flats constitutes the southern portion of Epping Forest and is one of the largest expanses of common land in London. The Flats have a number of established walks, with wonderful views of the city. Forest Gate can be accessed on foot via the flats and has a wide range of cafes, bars and restaurants.Woodlands Avenue is a five-minute bus ride from Leytonstone and Wanstead Tube stations where Central line services run to central London in approximately 20 minutes respectively. Leytonstone High Road station is slightly further afield and runs London Overground services through east London.

listing.description: A genuinely rare chance to acquire this two bedroom bay fronted Victorian period house in need of full modernisation and offering huge potential for extension. Located in the highly sought after 'Nightingale Triangle' close to Balham High Road with a choice of stations literally yards away; this well-proportioned end of terrace house has a 40 ft/50 ft South facing garden and is situated on a picturesque road in a quiet area close to central Balham. listing.description: Oak House is an attractive, deceptively large period property that has been extended and renovated over the years and is full of character with many original features still in place. On the ground floor the hallway leads through to the four reception rooms and a good-sized kitchen/ breakfast room with an Aga. The drawing room has an open fireplace and large bay window looking out towards the garden and there is a dining room with a door leading through to the sitting room. There is also a study, utility room and cloakroom.Upstairs is a spacious landing off which are five double bedrooms. The generous master bedroom suite has an en suite bathroom and dressing room area and there are lovely views down across the garden to the paddock beyond. The guest bedroom also has an en suite bathroom and there are 3 further double bedrooms and a family bathroom.Oak House is situated in Brimpton, an attractive rural village with a public house and church. Close to Newbury, it is surrounded by pretty countryside yet has good access to London and Reading.The area is popular for walking and riding. From the property, without crossing a road, there is a large network of footpaths and bridleways.Schools close by include Bradfield College, Pangbourne College, Elstree, Cheam, St Gabriel’s and Downe House as well as Brimpton Primary School in the village.Nearby Newbury, Reading and Thatcham offer a wide variety of shops and leisure opportunities including Newbury racecourse, various golf courses and the Watermill Theatre. Trout fishing is available on the rivers Lambourn, Kennet and Pang. Communications are very good with fast trains from Theale and Reading into London Paddington or from Basingstoke into London Waterloo. There is good access to the M4 and A34 linking with the national road network.The property is approached down a drive to the side of the house leading to a gravelled parking area and double garage.There are extensive gardens and grounds lying mostly to the rear of the house with an adjoining paddock beyond and in all the land totals about 3.41 acres. The gardens are mainly laid to lawn surrounded by mature trees and shrubs including a beautiful magnolia tree and there is a more recently planted area with a pergola. There is an abundance of snowdrops and daffodils in early Spring.There is stabling for 2 horses and a tack room as well as further storage in the garage (with water and power supply). The paddock can be accessed separately from a track at the side of the garden.There is a small pretty garden at the front of the house enclosed by mature hedging.
listing.short_description: An idylic equestrian property with circa 3.41 acres, stable and charming house in need of modernisation.
listing.displayable_address: Wasing Road, Brimpton, Reading, Berkshire RG7

listing.description: 26 Tenison Avenue is a well-presented Edwardian terraced property offering over 1,500 sq. Ft. Of bright and flexible accommodation arranged over three floors, sensitively modernised to offer the best of modern living with retained character features including decorative cast iron fireplaces, exposed floorboards and deep skirting boards and coving.The ground floor accommodation flows from a welcoming reception hall and briefly comprises a well-proportioned front aspect reception room with wooden floor, glazed bay window and feature cast iron fireplace with marble mantle, opening into a generous dining room with a second cast iron fireplace with marble mantle and French doors to the rear gardens. The ground floor accommodation is completed by a large dual aspect kitchen/breakfast room, which has a range of fitted units with integrated appliances, space for a table for more informal dining and garden access.On the first floor, the property boasts three well-proportioned bedrooms, all with built-in storage and serviced by a contemporary family bathroom with separate walk-in shower. To the second floor, the property offers two good-sized bedrooms, suitable for a variety of uses (stp, plumbing for a bathroom is already in situ)Tenison Avenue is to the south side of the city, in close proximity to Cambridge mainline railway station providing services to King’s Cross, in around 50 minutes and Liverpool Street in 70mins. It is within easy access of the local in shopping facilities on Hills Road and Mill Road together with many cafes, restaurants and the University Botanic Garden. Nearby schools, include St Mary’s, The Leys, Sancton Wood and The Stephen Perse Foundation as well as Hills Road Sixth Form CollegeThe property is accessed via an iron gate and by a low-maintenance paved front garden bordered on each side by low-level topiary. The property’s enclosed rear garden offers an area of level lawn bordered by mature shrubs, with a sizeable paved terrace providing an ideal space for entertaining and al fresco dining. To the rear of the garden are a timber shed and a double width pedestrian gate leading to private rear access bordering neighbouring gardens.
listing.short_description: A traditional central city townhouse set over three floors so convenient for the train station and the Botanic gardens.

listing.description: Kimber is a detached property situated in a highly desirable location about 1.5 miles north of Chichester city centre and overlooking open farmland. Having not come to the market since being built in about 1960 and now in need of some modernisation, this is rare opportunity to acquire a property with potential to further develop and extend (subject to planning).On entering the house, the spacious hallway leads to all the principal reception rooms, which includes a well-proportioned living room with dining space and a good size study. The study could easily be used as a ground floor bedroom. The kitchen and breakfast room is currently separated by open shelving and is adjacent to a large covered patio, accessed through a rear lobby. This also leads to a store and the large attached double garage. The ground floor is completed with a conservatory leading from the living room and a cloakroom.To the first floor, the spacious principal bedroom suite comprises a spacious bedroom, a dressing room (currently used as a first floor family room) and an en-suite bathroom. There are 3 further bedrooms (a double room and 2 single rooms), as well as a family bathroom and separate small shower room. All the bedrooms look out across the gardens and over the open farmland beyond.The house is set in surprisingly large gardens and grounds, totalling just over 0.4 acres. A driveway leads to the double garage and a parking area, with a side gate giving access to the gardens. The gardens stretch around the house and overlook open farmland to the west. The gardens are mostly laid to lawn edged with mature hedging and there is are vegetable patches to the northern end, along with a timber shed.Kimber is located in a peaceful and sought-after residential area in a popular part of Summersdale, which is convenient forChichester city centre and yet the beautiful countryside of the South Downs is easily accessible to the north. Summersdale offers 2 local convenience stores (one with a post office) and medical centre with pharmacy.The historic cathedral city of Chichester offers comprehensive shopping facilities and a choice of social and recreational activities, all of which are easily accessible through the mainly level pedestrian areas of the beautifully preserved City. The variety of social and recreational activities include sports centres with swimming pools, cinemas and a fine selection of restaurants, wine bars and bistros. Cultural activities include the award winning Pallant House Gallery and the internationally renowned Chichester Festival Theatre. There is an excellent choice of schools in the area, both state and private. Local sporting activities include events for motoring enthusiasts, golf and flying at Goodwood, with horseracing at Goodwood and Fontwell and sailing off the coast and on Chichester Harbour.
listing.short_description: A detached house on the market for the first time and offering a wonderful opportunity for renovation and further development (subject to planning), set in a highly sought-after location north of Chichester city centre with views over open farmland.

The property now absolutely must be viewed personally for its location and condition to be fully appreciated. In brief, to the first floor there are the four double bedrooms including an exceptional master bedroom with refitted en suite shower room in addition there is a luxuriously appointed family bathroom with separate shower. To the ground floor, a spacious reception hall with solid oak flooring provides access to accommodation incorporating an attractive and comfortable lounge 20’ x 13’7”, a study/TV room 13’7” x 8’3” and a fabulous custom fitted kitchen/dining/family room of around 24’ x 22’. In addition there is a refitted ground floor cloakroom. The property affords gas central heating via radiators and double glazed windows throughout. As previously mentioned the property is set within one of the best locations on this development fronting onto the green and pond and affords a road frontage of around 67’. The front garden has a block paved parking area for around three/four cars leading to an attached double width garage. To the rear, the south facing rear garden is completely secluded and measures approximately 67’ x 50’. We cannot over emphasize the need for a personal inspection to fully appreciate the size and quality of accommodation offered together with its location. Ref No. 4859-18. EPC D.

listing.description: Open day 1st of June 2019 - By Appointment Only.Yopa are pleased to bring to the market this well-presented family home, which was originally constructed in 1935 and has been tastefully modernised by the current owners. Offering just under 2000 SqFt of living space across ground and first floor. This is quite a sizeable property.Internal Living Space:On the ground floor buyers will find a significantly extended Kitchen and Dining space that is just short of 30ft in width. Featuring an impressive corian topped kitchen island with 5 ring hob and sink, this room is brightened by a stylish lantern style skylight as well as full-width bi-fold doors that open up on to a large patio space that could become an impressive outdoor living/entertaining space with the addition of tasteful garden furniture, bbq, potted plants etc.Also on the ground floor; a front reception room with bay window which has been recently fitted with stylish plantation shutters, W/C, Large utility room with side and garage access.On the first floor the property offers five double bedrooms as well as a family bathroom with shower above bath. There is excellent potential to extend this property further by the addition of a loft extension due to the property's sizeable loft space.It is also worth noting that the ground floor could also be reconfigured to offer more internal living space by converting the garage into an additional reception room and giving this property more of a double fronted appearance. *Subject to planning permission.Outside Space:This is an attractive property both inside and out, a mature Wisteria plant climbs the front of this property and really enhances its character adding to its already very strong kerb appeal.Buyers will also be impressed by a particulalry large West facing garden in excess of 100 feet with a combination of mature plants and shrubs running the full length of the garden. To the front of the property, there is a lawned area and driveway for 2 cars.Viewing Arrangments:This customer has opted for viewings to be conducted by a Local yopa Agent and the first opportunity to view this home will be on Saturday 1st of June 2019, when we will be holding an open day.All viewings are by appointment only so please get in contact to make your appointment to view this excellent home.
listing.short_description: Must see! Impressive 1930's five bedroom family home offering extended open plan kitchen/diner with full-width bi-fold doors, West facing garden in excess of 100ft, driveway for 2 cars and garage.  Open Day 1st of June 2019 - By appointment only.

listing.description: In an elevated and private location with stunning views across Haslemere, a modern four/five bedroom detached house within walking distance of the High Street and main line station.Santis is an individual non estate home originally built in the early 1960s and set in a lovely plot of around one third acre enjoying breathtaking views over Haslemere. The property was enlarged on two occasions during the late 1960s and 1980s and now provides deceptively spacious and adaptable accommodation, the majority of which is on the ground floor. The property has been cleverly positioned to take advantage of the views, in particular the fabulous split level sitting room which has an open fireplace. Also on the ground floor are two double bedrooms, study/bedroom five, dining room, wc and bathroom. listing.short_description:
In an elevated and private location with stunning views across Haslemere, a modern four/five bedroom detached house within walking distance of the High Street and main line station.

Santis is an individual non estate home originally built in the early 1960s and set in a lovely plot of around one third acre enjoying breathtaking views over Haslemere. The property was enlarged on two occasions during the late 1960s and 1980s and now provides deceptively spacious and adaptable accommodation, the majority of which is on the ground floor. The property has been cleverly positioned to take advantage of the views, in particular the fabulous split level sitting room which has an open fireplace. Also on the ground floor are two double bedrooms, study/bedroom five, dining room, wc and bathroom. There are two further bedrooms and bathroom on the first floor. The property lends itself to further enlargement and modernisation subject to Planning Permission. Other features include oil fired central heating, double glazing and large utility/boiler room. Santis is approached by its driveway from Courts Mount Road which leads to a parking area and the detached double garage which has electrically operated doors. On the western side of the property is a large terrace adjoining the sitting room - perfect for capturing the afternoon and evening sunshine. The remainder of the rear garden is laid to lawn and is well maintained with established boundaries providing privacy and seclusion.

listing.description: A spacious detached house, which offers an abundance of space, light and charm with the added appeal of facing country fields. A large hallway with parquet flooring provides access to a good size lounge with feature fireplace, which in turn flows through to a large dining room. The stunning kitchen has been modernised tastefully and comprises of wall and base units, Silestone worktops, integrated appliances, breakfast island and a separate utility room, again with fitted units. Finally on the ground floor we have a downstairs shower room and a third reception, providing further family space and integral access to the garage. To the upstairs there is the light filled landing with views of the countryside, a master bedroom with dressing area and en-suite, three further bedrooms and a family bathroom. The shingled driveway provides ample car parking and there is a garage with a second utility area to the rear. The landscaped garden is fantastic with scattered lighting, water features, sheds, vegetable patch and gated side access. Other benefits include double glazing, gas central heating (new boiler) and Cat 5 cabling, all in all a superb house in a lovely setting worthy of an internal viewing!

listing.description: A pretty detached period house dating back to the late 18th Century, set in mature gardens enjoying a corner plot position close to the centre of this highly sought after, quintessential English village. In need of modernisation and improvement, this attractive and spacious property hosts a range of original character features and boasts 3-4 bedrooms, 3 reception rooms, kitchen/breakfast room, garaging and parking and offers great scope and potential as well as the benefit of being sold with no onward chain.LocationSet on the corner of Church Road, close to the local infant school and village Cricket pitch, & within a few hundred yards of the Norman Church. Little Marlow has two established public house/restaurants in the Kings Head & The Queens Head and adjoins local countryside with access to the Thames Path with riverside walks to Bourne End & Marlow.Bourne End Village & Marlow Town Centre are both within two miles, both offering stations to London Paddington via Maidenhead (Cross Rail due in 2020). The Marlow bypass A404M is just over half a mile with direct routes to the M4 motorway at J8/9 Maidenhead (7 miles) and the M40 motorway at J4 Handy Cross (3 miles). Marlow town centre has an array of bustling individual shops, cafes & restaurants including 'The Ivy Marlow Garden' in the High Street & Tom Kerridges's 2 Michelin Star 'The Hand & Flowers' in West Street. For families, the house iis in the catchment for both Sir William Borlase & Great Marlow School.Local recreation facilities include golf at Harleyford, Temple & Winter Hill; walking, riding & cycling in the Hambleden Valley; sailing at the Upper Thames Sailing Club in Bourne End & from Bourne End Marina; rowing at Marlow Rowing Club; Little Marlow C.C. Almost adjoining; clubs for tennis, hockey, bowls & cricket all in Pound Lane, Marlow alongside the Court Garden Leisure Complex with swimming pool & gymnasium, as well as the National Sports Centre at Bisham Abbey.DirectionsFrom the centre of Marlow, proceed east from the obelisk at the top of the High Street, along Spittal Street towards Bourne End. Cross the mini roundabout into Chapel Street continue into the Little Marlow Road. Continue until reaching the roundabout with the A404, cross the roundabout towards Bourne End and turn right after about half a mile into Church Road when you see the sign for the Kings head pub/restaurant. Walnut Tree Cottage is the first driveway on the left hand side.
listing.short_description: A detached 3/4 bedroom period house, circa 1780, with many features including beams and open fireplaces plus three large reception rooms, detached garage and corner plot gardens. In need of complete refurbishment but with great potential. No onward chain.

listing.description: Randalls Residential Estate Agents. An attractive detached 'Musselwhite' family home with 5 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, standing in a mature garden.Reception hall, sitting room, conservatory, study, kitchen/ dining room, cloakroom, utility room, master bedroom with en suite bathroom room, guest bedroom with en suite shower room, three further bedrooms, family bathroom, gardens, double garage. EPC Band DM3 J6 1 mileLondon Waterloo from 45 minutesSituationThe property is situated in Skippetts Lane East, one of the more prestigious roads within Basingstoke, located to the south of the town but within walking distance of Queen Mary's College, the Festival Place shopping centre and the mainline railway station.Basingstoke offers a comprehensive range of leisure, recreational and educational facilities. There is good access for commuting with the M3 being a short distance away, and the mainline railway station in Basingstoke provides fast and frequent services to London Waterloo.The propertyBuild during the 1930's by renowned local developer Musselwhites, Merrymeet is a substantial and individual detached family home standing in private mature gardens. It has been carefully maintained and modernised by the current owners and now offers comfortable and well-presented accommodation and still retains the character and charm of its heritage.On the ground floor, the front door opens to the reception hall from which the staircase rises to the first floor, with cloakroom off. The spacious dual aspect sitting room has a bay window with French doors overlooking the garden, parquet flooring and an open fireplace, and a door leads to the adjoining dual aspect study/dining room. The kitchen/dining room is comprehensively fitted with an extensive range of units with ample worksurfaces and fitted appliances and overlooks the private rear terrace. Double doors open to the double-glazed conservatory from which French doors open to the garden. There is also a large utility room.On the first floor the spacious master bedroom has an en suite shower room, and there are three further bedrooms and the family bathroom.On the second floor is the spacious guest bedroom, also with an en suite shower room.For further details please refer to the floorplan.OutsideThe property is approached from the lane over a gated gravel driveway which provides parking in front of the two garages.The garden is enclosed by mature hedging and offers a high degree of privacy. Laid primarily to lawn, with a number of mature trees and bushes, the garden lies primarily to the front of the house with paved terrace outside the sitting room and a further and sheltered paved terrace to the rearServicesAll mains services are connectedLocal authorityBasingstoke and Deane Borough CouncilViewingBy prior appointment through Randalls Residential on Directions to RG21 3ATFrom the central one-way system in New Road in the centre of town, follow the signs to Alton on the Hackwood Road. Proceed straight over the first (Hackwood) roundabout, and at the next (Venture) roundabout take the third exit into Grove Road. After a short distance take the left hand turning into the Skippetts Lane East slip road, and, at the end, turn left into Skippetts Lane East proper and Merrymeet is the first house on the left hand side.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A detached family house, with attractive tile hung elevations, providing well proportioned accommodation with scope for some modernisation.Notable features are the triple aspect sitting room with French doors to the garden, the dining hall leading to the open plan kitchen and conservatory, which overlooks the garden.In addition to the 4 bedrooms to the first floor, is a very useful annexe room behind the garage, which could have several uses and overlooks the garden again.Overall, an opportunity to purchase a good family house with scope for general improvement or redevelopment (subject to planning consent) and recommended for its generous garden and location between Chobham and Weybridge.SituationChobham village offers a good selection of local facilities including convenience stores, restaurants and pubs. The area offers good leisure facilities including some of the finest golf clubs in the world, such as Wentworth, Sunningdale and Queenswood, horse racing at Ascot and Windsor, polo at Ascot and the Guards Club.Commuter road and rail links are excellent with Woking mainline station about 4 miles away with frequent direct trains to Waterloo (approx 27 mins)Junction 3 of the M3 is 4 miles away, Junc. 11 of the M25 2.5 miles, Terminal 5 at Heathrow 15 miles and central London 32 miles.There is also a good selection of both state and private schools including Hall Grove, Coworth Park, St Marys, The Marist, St Georges, Eton, acs and tasis.OutsideApproached down a no through lane and via double wooden gates, the property offers good parking in front of the double garage, with lawns forming most of the garden, with mature trees and shrubs. There is a rose arbour down the side of the garage and a paved terrace to one end of the house.Within the garden are 3 stables and a separate garage, as well as a separate access to the main road.In all, the gardens extend to 0.88 acre.
listing.short_description: A delightful, character house with scope for general improvement or development, complemented by a generous garden of 0.88 acre with the benefit of stables, 3 garages, an office/playroom behind the garage, a gated entrance and additional access.

New price - guide price £970K - A rural property offering extended family living comprising of a detached 4 bedroom listed period farmhouse with attached 2 bedroom cottage set in 6 acres (*tbv) with a range of barns, outbuildings and stabling and occupying an idyllic countryside position at the foot of the North Downs set. The versatile accommodation, which requires modernising, in all extends to just under 4000 sqft and is currently configured as two residences. Each property includes features such as exposed wall and ceiling beams, and original fireplaces. The farmhouse accommodation. 4 bedrooms, large kitchen/breakfast room, utility room and 2 bathrooms. The Cottage accommodation. 2 bedrooms, 2 receptions, kitchen and family bathroom; The acreage is divided up with a field of around 2 acres to the front plus separate woodland copse along the drive boundary and a field of around 3 acres to the rear . The immediate grounds around the farmhouse amount to around 1 acre including the range of outbuildings which are in generally good order and include: A large detached barn, 7 stables plus workshop ( N.B.
