No Chain.

Equestrian Facilities

Refer to the Floor Plan; Power, water and lighting laid on. Stable blocks - 7 Loose Boxes arranged in 3 blocks, (brick and block constructed under pitched concrete sheet roofing) arranged in an L shape with attached workshop- but could be used as tack and feed room if required. Barn - Approx 30ft x 60ft - large barn, timber constructed, over 1800sqft, double doors opening out to the front parcel of land and to the rear to the yard. Concrete floor and steel sheet roof.

Land & Grounds

The whole plot sits in approx. 6 acres (*tbv). This includes the front paddock, the rear paddock, the woodland strip down the driveway and the main residence and barn/equestrian facilities. The acreage stated at the property is 'tbv - *To Be Verified', which means that the land has not been formally measured by Equus and or its sellers/clients other than by obtaining the Title Plan from Land registry where available, with the boundary and acreage clearly stated/marked. Interested applicants/buyers are advised that if they have any doubts as to the plot size and wish to have verification of the exact size of the entire plot, they will be required to make their own arrangements by appointing the services of an accredited company who can measure the boundary for a compliant Land Registry Title Plan.

Situation

The farmhouse and cottage are situated in a sought after rural location yet close to the village of Detling offering local amenities. The village of Bearsted is also easily reached and offers a better range of amenities including shops, schools, doctors surgery, pharmacy, post office, bank, golf club, ports club, local public houses and restaurants. Bearsted also has a mainline railway station with connections to London, the coast and the continent. The county town of Maidstone is within approx. 2 miles distance and offers comprehensive shopping and amenities as well as 2 mainline stations. The property is also within easy distance of the M20 and M2 motorways providing links to London, M25, Gatwick and Heathrow Airports and to the Channel tunnel connecting to Europe.

Accommodation - Refer To The Floor Plan

The property is currently divided as two dwellings attached by one wall (shown in red on the floor plans). The whole building is listed Grade I I. The cottage - The smaller pf the two properties contains an assortment of period features including a large fireplace in the main sitting room. The kitchen is in need of modernising/replacing and the second room (dining room in the floor plan) has another feature fire place. On the first floor there are two bedrooms with period features also including beams to the ceilings currently divided with a stud wall. A family bathroom in the eaves with a bath/WC and wash hand basin. The farmhouse - The larger of the two properties has had an extension during the Victorian period. The balance spans from 15th C. Onward to the Victorian period. The house is entered via a long entrance hall with the interior boasting a number of period features: Including a sunken room (sitting room 2) furnished and built as a bar. The main reception room which has a centre fireplace, kitchen and breakfast room, utility room plus shower room with WC. On the first floor there are 4 bedrooms one with beams and a fireplace plus family bathroom.

Services & Outgoings

Tenure: Freehold local authority: Maidstone Borough Council services: Septic Tank shared, Central Heating Oil. Tax band: The Cottage C. Harple Farmhhouse G. EPC rating: Nil, Grade listed building

listing.description: This truly stunning four bedroom fully detached bungalow has been extended and modernised to the very highest of standards. It boasts a very impressive square footage (approx. 2,350) of living accommodation and sits on an impressive plot. There is a large front garden, accessed via a 5 bar gate, offering plenty of off street parking, leading to an integral 33' double garage with electric garage door. Lights, CCTV, security alarm and heating in the property can be controlled via the internet. The core of the house is heated through a wet underfloor heating system. House was re-wired and a new boiler system added as part of the extension.Internally, the property commences with a stylish entrance hallway with customised furniture for storage. An inner lobby passes two bedrooms on each flank and leads to the main reception area and without question the wow factor of the property. It is here where you appreciate the 'U' shaped design of the bungalow as it was built to wrap around the outdoor heated swimming pool.Contemporary new kitchen that overlooks the pool, with a beautiful island and breakfast bar that offers plenty of storage space. Top of the range double oven (combination microwave oven and steam oven), ceiling extractor, dishwasher, large induction hob, Quooker tap for instant boiling water, water softner and built-in water filter for the kitchen tap.This is where the open plan comes into effect as there is an opening to the 18'1 x 14'3 lounge a corridor that carries on (with bi folding doors) to the guest bedroom with an en-suite and built in cupboard. To the other side of the property is the forth bedroom (still 12'1 x 9'), door to the 33' integral garage and another door to the gym. The gym also has bi-folding doors overlooking the pool.The heated swimming pool is 24'x 12' and has a fitted protective roll cover, occupies the front half of the approximately 80' rear garden. listing.description: Entering the property on the ground floor, you are greeted by a long corridor with a double reception room to the right. The reception room is generous in size with space for two seating areas and large sash windows at each end of the room; allowing for an abundance of light.Downstairs on the lower ground floor are the kitchen and dining room, with space for a large dining table and chairs. There is also a sizable storage cupboard at front of the room and some fitted storage along one side.The kitchen itself has plenty of storage and worktop space, a gas hob with oven below and extractor fan above, space for a washing machine and an integrated fridge/freezer.Continue up to the first floor where there are two bedrooms and a bathroom. Both bedrooms could have a double bed, as well as free-standing storage. The bathroom contains a bath with overhead shower, wash basin with mirror above, large storage cupboard and a W.C.The top floor of the house also has two bedrooms, with the larger located at the front of the property. Both rooms are big enough for a double bed and free-standing storage.The garden is accessed from the ground floor at the rear of the property and is a generous size, currently paved with a garden shed at the back. It is also almost directly south facing. Also, on this level next to the door to the garden is a convenient W.C. For guests.Location:Sutherland Square is both charming and elegant, whilst being conveniently situated just off the vibrant Walworth Road, which is bursting with amenities. Heading south you will find Burgess Park with its tea rooms and tennis courts and north, you will find the trendy street food market of Mercato Metropolitano; a must for any resident.Directions:Walworth Road is well served by a frequent bus service to Elephant & Castle Underground/Overground Station; which takes you onward into Central London and even out to the home counties. Kennington Underground Station (Northern Line – both branches) is only a mere 0.6 mile walk away.

listing.description: A detached character family home of excellent proportions, pleasantly situated in a sought after cul-de-sac of individual properties within an easy level walk of Dorking Town yet backing onto open countryside. The shopping centre & schools are approximately half a mile away & Dorking Commuter Station just over one mile. With stunning views across to Ranmore & St Martins Church this family home offers the best of both worlds.As soon as you step through the front door, a warm welcome awaits you with a grand staircase rising to the first floor &doors to the downstairs accommodation and cloakroom.The renewed country style kitchen offers ample cupboard and drawer space & extensive worktop space for dining for friends & family. For informal dining you have space for a table & chairs where you can enjoy the breathtaking views.For formal dinners, the impressive dining room is perfect with a feature fireplace. The ideal room for dinner receptions.When you retire at the end of the day, the sitting room with its sunny aspect offers a relaxing haven & hearth where you can read a good book or chat with the family.On the first floor are three good sized double bedrooms with the master to the front of the house with an ensuite and the rear bedrooms having views to the Surrey Hills.The bathroom has been fully modernised to offer a four piece bathroom suite with walk in shower, large bath, wc & wash hand basin.On the second floor are two further bedrooms ideal as a guest suite, teenagers retreat or au pair accommodation.Outside, the mature, secluded gardens are a real feature of the house, perfect for children to play or to enjoy a glass of wine and appreciate the beautiful surroundings.To the front of the house is a lawned garden, driveway for several cars & access to the garage.The house boasts fitted carpets throughout the reception areas & bedrooms as well as gas fired heating, part double glazing & cavity wall insulation.

listing.description: A beautiful example of a four double bedroom Victorian terraced house, located on a quiet and sleepy street between the amenities in Clapham and Brixton. Margate Road is located in a popular residential pocket of pretty Victorian terraces, equidistant to both sought-after locations, and will appeal to purchasers who are contemplating moving to the two areas.This property has been lovingly modernised and extended by its present owners within the last three years, whilst maintaining great sensitivity to the charm of this period. This includes a fantastically designed side extension with large glass panels and multiple skylights. The stunning kitchen diner has concertina doors that allow the living space to flood seamlessly into the well-maintained, landscaped secluded garden at the rear. The double aspect reception and dining room is packed full of character with wooden flooring, a feature fireplace, bespoke shelving and double glazed sash windows.The first floor comprises a beautiful master bedroom running the width of the building with high ceilings and views over the neighbouring terrace row, two further double bedrooms and a beautifully finished shower room, boasting a stylish walk-in shower. Stairs lead to the second floor and a wonderful loft style bedroom with skylights and views over the neighbouring gardens at the rear, plus a second luxurious family bathroom.With nearly 1400 square feet of internal living space this chain-free property is a fantastic family home with a beautifully light and airy contemporary finish, ample built-in storage and ideal for any purchasers looking to move into a new house hassle-free.This lovely home is nestled on Margate Road, a peaceful road which is highly sought after for its character, feel and proximity to both Brixton and Clapham. The bars and restaurants of Acre Lane are a short walk and within an eleven minute stroll down the road is everything that Brixton has to offer, from music venues and the extremely popular Brixton Village, to large brand shops and cracking transport links. The vibrant and diverse Clapham High Street is an eleven minute walk in the other direction, offering great nightlife and culinary delights. Potential purchasers will benefit from both the Northern Line (Clapham North, Clapham Common and Clapham South tube stations) and the Victoria Line (Brixton tube station). With the wonderful green spaces of Brockwell Park and its iconic 1930s Lido also within easy reach, the location cannot be understated. There are few properties in the area that have as many positive attributes, from the style, size, outside space and the proximity to all the action the area has to offer.
listing.short_description: A spacious, well-designed four double bedroom Victorian house located in a residential pocket equidistant to Brixton and Clapham.

Fees to Tenants
Prospective tenants interested in renting a property through Goldschmidt & Howland will need to be aware of the following pre-tenancy costs that may be due prior to the commencement of a tenancy. Please further note that in some situations properties may be advertised on behalf of another agency, in which case the following fees and charges may vary and prospective tenants will be advised of any such variation in fees and charges upon enquiry.

Before you move in...

Reservation Fee - Equivalent to two weeks rent - deductible from the first month's rental if the tenancy proceeds.

Please note that should the tenant withdraw their application to rent the property at any time, through no fault of the landlord, or the tenant fails the referencing process, or fails to provide the required information in accordance with the referencing criteria provided, or it is established that the tenant or any of their dependents do not have the right to rent in the UK, the tenant will be required to compensate the landlord and Goldschmidt & Howland by paying up to the full amount of the Reservation Fee the reasonable costs incurred in preparing the property for the tenancy or complying with any of the special conditions as requested by the tenant. If the property is withdrawn from the market the tenant will also be required to compensate the landlord for an amount equal to the rent for the period that the property is withdrawn from the market.

Tenancy Agreement Fee
£180.00 (inc VAT) per tenancy. Preparation and drawing up of the Tenancy Agreement.

Please note that both the Tenancy Agreement Fee and Reference Fee are non-refundable should the tenancy be aborted through no fault of the landlord, this may include (but not limited to) the tenants decision to withdraw from the tenancy prior to the signing of the tenancy agreement, if the tenant or guarantor fails the referencing process or it is established that the tenant or any of their dependents do not have the right to rent in the UK.

Reference Fee
£48.00 (inc VAT) per Tenant /Guarantor
£84.00 inc VAT for Company

Security Deposit
Equivalent to 6 weeks rent.

Pet Deposit
In addition to the Security Deposit, a further 2 weeks rent will be required for pets.

During your tenancy...

Amendment/Change of Tenant Fee
£500.00 (inc VAT) Contract negotiation, amending terms and updating your tenancy agreement during the tenancy. Each new tenant will be subject to referencing and liable for the Reference Fee of £48.00 (inc VAT) per tenant or guarantor.

Renewal Fee
£84.00 (inc VAT) Contract negotiation and arranging a paperwork.

At the end of your tenancy...

Check out Fee
This cost is dependent on the size of the property - prices inclusive of VAT:

Studio £78 - £144
1 Bed £102 - £144
2 Bed £108 - £156
3 Bed £120 - £192
4 bed £138 - £258
5 Bed + £180 - £288

Early Termination Fee - Should you agree with the landlord to terminate your tenancy before you are permitted to do so, you will be responsible for the repayment of the pro-rata letting or renewal fee paid in advance by the landlord for the period of the tenancy agreed up until it could lawfully be ended by the tenant, plus any additional reasonable costs incurred by the landlord in the re-letting of the property.

Other fees and charges...

Unpaid Rent/Returned Payments - Interest at 4% above Bank of England Base Rate from date due.

If you have any questions on our fees, please ask a member of the Lettings Team

A stunning first floor landing with light filtering through all the rooms from the magnificent stained glass window.

Master Bedroom (7.29 x 4.80 (23'11" x 15'8"))

A good sized master bedroom with twin aspect, overlooking the treetops and garden.

Ensuite

Oversized bathtub, with W.C., and wash basin. Large window.

Bedroom 2 (7.14 x 4.47 (23'5" x 14'7"))

Far Eastern themed room, with large bay window overlooking the garden.

Ensuite 2

Walk in wet room with mosaic sandstone tiling, W.C. And wash basin. White porcelain sliding doors.

Bedroom 3 (3.94 x 3.53 (12'11" x 11'6"))

Double bedroom with twin windows facing south.

Bedroom 4 (4.37 x 3.68 (14'4" x 12'0"))

Double bedroom with twin windows overlooking the garden.

Bathroom 1

Modern bathroom suite with terracotta tiles, bath with shower over, W.C. And wash basin.

First Floor W.C.

Sand coloured tiles, with W.C. And wash basin.

Bedroom 5 With Snug (5.11 x 3.89 (16'9" x 12'9"))

Fantastic guest or teenager room, with double aspect outlook, and incorporating a cosy snug area.

Bathroom 2

Good sized bathroom with bath, separate electric shower, W.C., and wash basin.

Bedroom 6 (5.77 x 3.53 (18'11" x 11'6"))

Double bedroom facing south.

Bedroom 7 (5.0 x 3.18 (16'4" x 10'5"))

Double bedroom with sloping ceilings.

Potential Bathroom 3/Utility Room

Plumbing for washing machine or a third bathroom.

Rear Garden

A lovely south facing garden, bordered with mature shrubs and seasonal flowers beds. Leading from the kitchen doors, and also accessed via the side gates, there is a patio along the length of the house, with low level balustrade. Stairs lead down to the peaceful garden, with lawned area, part patio, and a pleasant gazebo with seating area (included in the sale). There is a luxury heated swimming pool with solar effect electric cover, enabling you to swim all year round.

Vendors' Comment

We have lived here for 7 years and absolutely love everything about the house. It is incredibly warm and easy to enjoy, especially while relaxing and entertaining with friends and family. We have faithfully restored and retained as many original features as possible, whilst opening up the house to create as much natural light throughout. The pool is fantastic for us, and for the children to spend all day playing around the garden.

listing.description: A beautiful early Victorian semi detached family house of Townscape Merit located in the heart of Kingston town centre, with the convenience of a private driveway and off street parking as well as extremely generous and, secluded rear garden. In need of some modernisation, it comes with excellent proportions and wonderful character features throughout. The ground floor offers two reception rooms, both with feature fireplaces, as well as a very large separate kitchen, whilst beyond that comes an additional shower room and W.C. The first floor is arranged over a bright split level and comprises three double bedrooms as well as further generous single bedroom and bathroom. Excellent storage is provided in the form of a loft and cellar. Externally, the property opens out onto an a very generous and private rear garden with wide side return and access back to the front of the house. Planning permission has also been granted for a large kitchen extension encompassing the outside conservatory area. Orchard Road is situated in the heart of Kingston town centre and benefits from the convenience of being within walking distance of just about all local amenities. Kingston's Zone 6 railway station is within a 0.4 mile (8 minute walk) of the property. Access to both the River Thames is great, whilst Richmond Park's Kingston Gate offers the opportunity to enjoy the largest Royal Park in London covering an area of 2,500 acres. From its heights, uninterrupted views of St Paul's Cathedral can be enjoyed, 12 miles away, whilst the Isabella Plantation offers a 40 acre Victorian woodland garden created in the 1830's and is best known for its evergreen azaleas, which line the ponds and streams. Created by Charles I in the 17th century as a deer park, it is of national and international importance for wildlife conservation. Furthemore, Fairfield Recreation Ground is within moments of the property. Kingston town centre offers a varied and comprehensive choice in shops via the High Street and Clarence Street as well as both Bentalls & John Lewis department stores. Kingston Riverside also offers a number of well known and popular restaurants.
listing.short_description: A beautiful early Victorian semi detached family house of Townscape Merit located in the heart of Kingston town centre, with the convenience of a private driveway and off street parking as well as extremely generous and, secluded rear garden.

listing.description: A 3-bedroom detached property in need of repair & refurbishment.The property stands on a plot measuring approximately 165’ (50.29m) x 45’ (13.72m).Subject to obtaining the necessary planning consents; there is scope to enlarge the existing property to the side and rear. There is further scope to redevelop the site fully - with a possibility of separating the plot front to rear, as it has a rear boundary and single brick built garage approached from Windmill Lane.Accommodation3 bedrooms2 receptionKitchenground floor bathroomdetached garage to rearfront & rear gardensvarious outbuildingsviewings by appointment onlyFront entrance porch with front door opening to;Hallway Stairs rising to first floor, beamed ceiling, colour leaded window to side (into conservatory), doors opening to;Front Reception 14’ into bay x 12’ into chimney recess (4.27m 3.66m)Tiled fireplace, bay window to front.Rear Reception 14’9 max x 13’ max room not square (4.50m x 3.96m)Beamed ceiling, part panelled walls, gas fireplace (not tested), oriel bay window to side, windows to rear, and door through to;Conservatory - to front (8’ x 7’9) electricity meter and fuse board.Kitchen 10’6 x 7’3 plus pantry cupboard to under stair area (3.20m x 2.21m)Window to side and door opening to rear lobby, with door to garden, and further door opening to;Ground Floor Bathroom 6’ x 5’6 (1.83m x 1.68m)Panel enclosed cast iron bath, wash hand basin, WC, window to rear.First floor Landing with access to loft, window to side, doors opening to;Bedroom 1 15’ x 13’6 (4.57m x 4.11m)Covered fireplace, double aspect with oriel bay window to front and window to rear.Bedroom 2 12’ x 12’ (3.66m x 3.66m)Gas fireplace (not tested), oriel bay window to front.Bedroom 3 10’6 x 10’ (3.20m x 3.05m)Fitted cupboard housing hot water cylinder, sink set on vanity unit, window to rear.Front Garden – Driveway approach with gate leading to hardstanding to side of property.Off-street parking for 3 or 4 vehicles.Rear GardenPartially laid to lawn, mature trees and shrubs to borders. Rear section of garden once arranged as a kitchen garden. There is a brick built garden store, a detached brick built garage with pitched roof (approached via Windmill Lane), and several wooden garden sheds.Please note: To the centre of the rear garden is a brick and concrete air-raid shelter, now used for storage – the executors have emptied the main house of all furniture, but the garden & outbuildings will need to be cleared by the purchaser.All viewings will be by way of block appointments - please call us for more details.This is an Executor Sale. The property is in need of repair & modernisation – cash buyers preferred.The Estate will seek a swift exchange of contracts – unconditional on planning (STC only).

listing.description: Set within approximately 3.7 acres of gardens and woodland, off a quiet, single track country lane, is this deceptively spacious four bedroom family home, enjoying extended and open plan ground floor accommodation, possible annex, garage and stables/workshop. The house requires some modernisation and has the potential to form a fabulous family home.Offered with no onward chain. EPC Rating E.Stream House is one of those often sought, seldom found houses, enjoying generously proportioned and light rooms, garaging, stabling/workshops and approximately 3.7 acres of gardens and woodland, all set off a quiet, single track country lane.The property presents an attractive facade, complete with white painted brickwork and a tiled roof. The house was extended by the current owners with a single story extension providing open plan living space with a fabulous view out across the garden. This extension also provided the Vendors with a self-contained area to the rear of the house, suitable for working from home with staff access, kitchen and cloakroom. It is this area that could easily form an annex, subject to little alteration and any necessary consents.The house itself is approached via a glazed porch and oak front door to the entrance hall, with oak flooring and oak staircase to the first floor. It is noted that the oak used in the staircase came from the garden! The entrance hall leads into an inner lobby, with access to a cloakroom and utility room/boiler room.A door from the inner lobby leads into the kitchen area, comprising a range of pale lemon units with cupboards and drawers, tiled worktops, tiled floor, integrated stainless steel double sink with drainer and waste disposal, space for cooker, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. This area is open to a breakfast area, which in turn opens into the open plan family/dining room, with windows and doors to the garden and a lovely vista up and across the garden.There is a wide opening into the sitting room, complete with windows to front and an open fireplace with a slate hearth and metal surround. The white oak flooring continues from the sitting room through the family/dining room.On the opposite side of the hall is another generous reception room complete with open fireplace with sandstone surround and extended hearth. This room is currently used as a studio, but could easily provide a formal dining room/TV or play room as required. There is a double aspect to front and side, and beneath this room, accessed from the outside, is a basement store room.The first floor landing has a window and French doors to a balcony, wooden flooring and provides access to all the bedrooms. The master bedroom is above the studio, with windows to front and side, fitted wardrobes and a walk-in wardrobe that could easily form an en-suite shower room. Opposite is another generous, double aspect bedroom, with several fitted wardrobes and drawer units. There is a lovely outlook over the garden from this room.Towards the rear of the property is the family bathroom, with bath, separate shower, basin, bidet, WC, towel rail and window to rear. There are two further bedrooms, either large singles or small doubles, both of which enjoy a view down the garden to the woodland beyond.It is considered that there is ample scope to enlarge the first floor, over the extended ground floor, subject to obtaining the necessary consents.Outside, to the front is the driveway with ample parking and turning for several vehicles. There is a brick built garage/carport and attached stables/workshops opposite the house. Flower bed borders the path to the front door, and a path leads around the house to the raised patio/seating area which enjoys sunshine the whole day and commands a view up and down the garden. The path leads all the way around the house, and at the rear of the house there is a shed, greenhouse and vegetable patch.The rest of the garden is laid to lawn, or left wild with mature trees and shrubs, such as rhododendrons, providing considerable scope for landscaping and/or formalizing. Beyond the fabulous beech tree the lawn narrows and heads into an area of evergreen woodland, with an area of deciduous, broad-leaf woodland beyond that. In total, the plot is approximately 3.7 acres.Location:Stream House is located off a very quiet country lane, which only links other quiet country lanes, between the villages of Rotherfield, Five Ashes and Hadlow Down. It is exceptionally quiet and peaceful.The nearest shops and supermarket can be found at Rotherfield and Jarvis Brook both of which are just over 5 minutes away. For more comprehensive shopping facilities, including various supermarkets, banks and high street shops, Heathfield, Crowborough and Uckfield are all within a 15 minute drive.All the local villages have renowned primary schools, and just a few minutes away is the popular Skippers Hill Preparatory School. There is a choice of secondary schools in both the private and state sectors within a twelve mile radius.The nearest railway station, Crowborough, is at Jarvis Brook just over five minutes away with services to London Victoria. Mainline services to London Charing Cross and Canon Street are available from Wadhurst or Tunbridge Wells stations. Gatwick is approximately 50 minutes drive across the Ashdown Forest, the Dartford Tunnel some 60 minutes via the M25 and the Channel Tunnel approximately 80 minutes drive via the M20.The area is well served by sports and leisure facilities with swimming pools and leisure centres at nearby Crowborough and Uckfield, a local 9 hole Golf Course, tennis clubs, footpaths and bridleways, sailing and fishing at Bewl Reservoir, plus outdoor pursuits at Bowles Outdoor Centre and Bedgebury Pinetum. The area also provides the only inland outdoor climbing in the South East on the sandstone outcrops of The Weald. The coast at Eastbourne is also only around a 40 minute drive to the South.Mains water and electricity, oil central heating, private drainage and Cat5e Ethernet to main rooms. Council Tax Band: G.

listing.description: Ladyfield House is a period, unlisted family house. Formerly two farm workers’ cottages, the property was converted into one house some years ago. Over the years it has been a much loved family home but would now benefit from being updated. Rooms are generously proportioned and light, with good ceiling heights. The drawing room is particularly appealing as it has two lovely bay windows overlooking the front and side gardens, whilst at the other end of the room French windows open onto the rear lawn; making it ideal for entertaining. There is a good size kitchen withadjacent utility room, and another door leadingto the dining room. Stairs lead to the first floorwhere the dual aspect study overlooks the front garden, as does the master bedroom next door. This bedroom has useful fitted wardrobes and an en suite bathroom. A further bedroom and family bathroom complete the first floor accommodation. The second floor comprises two further bedrooms, one of which is particularly large and has a wash hand basin.Ladyfield House lies in an enviable location in the parish of Stratfield Mortimer, on the outer edge of the village of Mortimer Common. There is an excellent range of local facilities including supermarket, post office, schools, library, anddoctor's and dentist's surgeries. Mortimer station is only a few minutes’ walk away with trains to Reading and Basingstoke easily accessed, and subsequent links to London from within the hour. With the arrival of Crossrail into Reading in 2019, journey times and connectivity to Canary Wharf and the City will dramatically improve. Four services an hour during peak times are currently being publicised, and a journey time to Canary Wharf from Reading from 68 minutes. There is also excellent access to the M4 junction 11 and the M3 junction 5 with links to the national motorway network, central London, Heathrow and Gatwick Airports. There are several good schools in the area including Elstree School, Bradfield College, Downe House and Pangbourne College.Sitting in its plot of just under one and a half acres, Ladyfield House is in a unique situation.Lying in an elevated positon at the side of Foudry Brook, it overlooks its gardens and a very large fish pond edged by trees and bushes. To the other side of the house is the delightful Church of St Mary the Virgin. The house is approached via a 5 bar gate and a long private tarmac drive leads across the partially fenced paddock to a double garage from where a pretty footbridge gives access to the house.The large, historic Fish Pond to the east of the house is a unique and very special feature. It is thought to have been dug in past centuries tosupply fish to Stratfield Mortimer Manor (now gone) and is home to a large head of Carp (Common and Mirror) and is a wonderful havenfor wildlife. Due to its history and rarity it is registered as such with the Environment Agency.To the rear of the house a paved area leads onto he lawn and a brick and timber outbuilding, which houses separate workshop and storage areas. Past the outbuilding a further area can be found alongside the brook which has widened out at this stage, and is bordered by mature trees and open farmland.
listing.short_description: A charming period family home in need of some modernisation, set in an idyllic yet very convenient location.  View online now with 3D virtual viewing

listing.description: A spacious four bedroom detached family home with scope for modernisation. Outbuildings, planning for annexe, stables with circa 2 acres and a separate 3 acre paddock.DescriptionThe Croft is positioned centrally in a generous plot, which enjoys far reaching views from almost every angle. Upon entering the property there is a good sized hallway which leads to the ground floor accommodation.There are two reception rooms, both with bay windows over looking the fields to the front of the property. The kitchen / breakfast room is attractively designed with fitted appliances and a Belfast sink. The property also benefits from a triple aspect informal garden room. The utility room is substantial and there is also a study which also has views over the stunning local countryside. An outer lobby leads to the downstairs cloakroom and offers access to the rear gardens.The first floor has four double bedrooms, each benefiting from delightful countryside views. The master bedroom benefits from an en-suite and a modern family bathroom with Victorian style roll top bath completes the internal accommodation.The Croft would now benefit from some cosmetic updating and modernisation, it offers the purchaser an excellent opportunity to take the house to the next level. There is also scope to extend to the rear of the property subject to planning.Grounds and gardensThe Croft benefits from an array of outbuildings, these include a small 5 bay stable block, four large stores and a double bay garage. Outline planning has been granted to convert the existing stores into a one and two bedroom residential accommodation.
listing.short_description: A spacious four bedroom detached family home with scope for modernisation. Outbuildings, planning for annexe, stables with circa 2 acres and a separate 3 acre paddock.

listing.description: A three bedroom semi-detached house requiring modernisation, located on a quiet cul de sac on the edge of Alexandra Palace and close to Muswell Hill Broadway.The Owners Love"For me, the best thing about Springfield Avenue and the thing the makes it stands out is the fantastic, uninterrupted view of London from the rear of the property. Sitting out on the patio, taking in that view from the elevated position of the house is something the family will always remember and cherish""When you couple that with the proximity of the house to the heart of Muswell Hill, one of the few locations in London that retains a village feel while offering all the shops, restaurants and facilities you want on your doorstep""Springfield Avenue is a quiet, neighbourly cul-de-sac so there is no through traffic and yet a footpath leads directly to Alexandra Palace, the adjoining parkland, boating lake, ice skating rink and organized events; the neighbours are all friendly"We've NoticedOther houses on the road have extended into the loft, to the rear and some have created a basement.

listing.description: Fine and Country. An ultra-modern house which has undergone extensive building, extending and modernising works. The interior is faultless; immaculate and functional. Located in the heart of South Cheam, the surrounding area is extremely affluent and sought after.The house has virtually been rebuilt since its purchase. The benefit of such a house is the assurance of mod cons such as underfloor heating, built-in CCTV and fashionable fixtures.Taking full advantage of the corner plot, the house has a wide driveway and ample off-street parking. listing.description: LocationThis unique detached family home is coming to the market for the first time in over 20 years! With accommodation arranged over three floors there is ample living and entertaining space to meet the needs of an aspiring modern family; Entering the property via the front aspect veranda into the welcoming entrance hall you will find the fully equipped kitchen breakfast room with granite work tops and under unit lighting, a cloakroom., The inter communicating family room / reception room has internal French doors to the main living room and a spiral stair case to the lower floor. The living room is open to the dining room with a dual aspect and also has doors leading to the raised decked terrace. Following the spiral stair case to the lower floor you enter a perfect room currently used as a home office that has patio doors to the garden, from here you can access a bright reception room / family room then following the internal hall way you are led to the double integral garage and bedroom 5 / guest bedroom plus a family bathroom. Returning to the main entrance and taking the stairs to the top floor you will find 4 big bright double bedrooms and another bathroom with separate shower cubicle. To the front of the property is a sweeping drive way leading to off street parking for approx. 10 cars. The Rear garden is mature, established and screened from neighbours. This extremely spacious and adaptable home requires a degree of re-modernisation internally and externally but is an opportunity not to be missed for buyers looking to acquire a forever home.

listing.description: 1 hill gardensStreatley on thames - berkshireGoring Station 0.75 miles Wallingford 5 miles. Reading 9.5 milesHenley on Thames 13 miles. Newbury 14 miles Oxford 18 milesM4 at Theale (J.12) 10 miles M40 at Lewknor (J.6) 15 miles(Distances Approximate)Occupying a mature elevated position adjacent to the scenic National Trust woodland and hillsides which commanding views of Streatley and the Thames valley, yet close to the central 'Conservation Area' of this pretty Thameside village, within but a minutes’ walk of the highly revered village primary school, and easily accessible for the shops / amenities and mainline railway station in Goring providing access to London Paddington in under the hour.A charming family residence of approximately 2,501 sq ft in total, set in pretty landscaped mature gardens & grounds, having been sympathetically extended and newly modernised to an exacting and appealing standard, affording spacious and flexible accommodation of an open plan yet traditional nature, with stylish fixtures and fittings evident throughout, and a relaxing ambience and outlook.• Stunning Situation Close To National Trust Wooded hillsides with wonderful walks and far reaching views• Private Driveway• Covered Front Porch• Reception Hall• Cloakroom• Kitchen / Breakfast Room With Vaulted Family Room• Utility Room• Dining Room• Living Room With Fireplace• Study• Games Room• Spacious Landing• Airing Cupboard• Master Bedroom Suite With En-Suite Shower Room• 4 Further Bedrooms• Family Bathroom• In All Approximately 2,501 Sq Ft• Professionally Landscaped Gardens & Grounds affording privacy & seclusion• Timber Workshop / Summer House• Loggia With Scandinavian Style Hot Tub• In All Approximately 0.163 Of An AcreSituationThe picturesque village of Streatley on Thames lies in a valley on the Berkshire side of the river between Reading and Oxford, facing Goring on the Oxfordshire side. The surrounding countryside is designated an area of ‘Outstanding Natural Beauty’ and historically this was a natural crossing point of the river, set between the Berkshire Downs and Chiltern Hills, known geographically as the ‘Goring Gap’. The interesting High Street, which forms the central part of the village running down to the river and the bridge across to Goring, is now a ‘Conservation Area’ where there are a wealth of period properties many of considerable architectural merit including a thatched cottage, a beautiful William and Mary house and an Elizabethan Farmhouse, supposedly haunted by a lady in white. Following the building of the railway through the Thames Valley by Isambard Kingdom Brunel in approximately 1840, the villagers of Streatley decided the railway should go on the Goring side with the result now that while Streatley has changed little, the village of Goring on Thames has grown substantially and is now the larger village.In the village there is a parish church with Norman origins, a luxury riverside four star hotel, The Swan, which also offers a leisure and fitness club and at the top of the High Street is the Bull Inn which was an old coaching inn when the Royal Mail stopped en-route between Oxford and London. There is also a prestigious golf club, established over one hundred years ago, set amidst beautiful rolling countryside. The village also boast its own very well regarded Streatley Primary School, with the outstanding secondary school, ‘The Downs’, being in catchment for the village also, and having its own bus route. The local area is also extremely well catered for by private schools, with school busses also leaving from the end of Townsend Road for St Helen & St Catherine’s, and The Manor.Behind Streatley the ground rises steeply where the Berkshire Downlands meet the wide Thames Valley and from the top there are panoramic views far into Oxfordshire. The woodland and hills surrounding Streatley have been acquired in recent years by the National Trust and the extensive bridleways and footpaths are now open to the public.Across the river, the larger village of Goring on Thames offers a wide range of amenities and facilities including shops, modern health centre, traditional inns, a hotel, library, dentist and importantly a main line railway station providing excellent commuter services to Oxford, Reading and up to London (Paddington). There is also easy access for the major local towns, including Oxford, Reading and Newbury, the M40 and M4 motorways, the latter linking directly to Heathrow.In 2019 Crossrail services are scheduled to be commencing from Reading which together with the electrifying of the line will significantly improve travelling times to Paddington and central London destinations.Hill Gardens built by well-respected builder John Wakefield in the late 1980’s, is a select small development of impressive detached houses of differing architectural design and appearance, quietly located in an elevated setting close to the heart of the village and the historic High Street, and only a few minutes’ walk from the highly ‘Ofsted’ rated Primary School. The locally based Developer John Wakefield has gained an enviable reputation for building superior traditionally designed Homes of high quality in premier locations.Property description1 Hill Gardens enjoys an advantageous position overlooking private mature grounds that surround the property and a lightly wooded small copse opposite. Incorporating a traditional and most attractive architectural design, the property has appealing multi stock red brick elevations under a pitched clay tiled roof with a large covered porch overlooking the front gardens.The accommodation is light and bright benefiting from large windows and is well apportioned offering spacious family sized accommodation. Enlarged and modernised throughout, with kitchen and bathrooms newly installed, careful attention has been paid to enhance the original architectural features, whilst adding a more contemporary flair, with open plan modern accommodation blending seamlessly with that of a more traditional nature culminating in the presentation of a super family home.A wonderful opportunity afforded, early viewing is advised.Gardens & groundsThe property has a wide mature frontage to Hill Gardens with a delightful mainly lawned garden extending across the frontage with at one end, a two-car wide entrance drive leading to the original garaging, now forming a store to the front, and Games Room to the rear.There are pedestrian paths running across the front and down the sides of the house meeting tall wooden pedestrian gates giving access through to the rear garden, whilst also providing additional security.The main garden lies to the rear of the property and is neatly lawned with established trees and shrubs around the boundaries, providing additional privacy and an attractive backdrop. Extending across the rear of the house, approached through the patio doors from the dining room and the veranda, is a wide stone laid patio terrace, perfect for ‘Al Fresco’ dining. To the further end of the terrace, attractively sited under a timber logia, there is a Scandinavian style hot tub.Both private and delightfully attractive, the gardens and grounds extend to approximately 0.163 of an acre and must be viewed to be fully appreciated.General servicesServices: Mains electricity, water, and drainage are connected to the property. Central heating and domestic hot water from gas fired boiler.Postcode: RG8 9QFCouncil Tax: GEPC Rating: D / 57Local Authority: West Berkshire District Council. Telephone directionsFrom our offices in the centre of Goring turn left and proceed down the High Street cross over the River Bridge and continue up to the traffic lights at the top of Streatley High Street. Continue straight across onto the Aldworth Road and after passing The Bull car park take the next turning left into The Coombe and then immediately left into Bull Meadow where in a further 100 yards will be seen the turning right into Hill Gardens. No.1 is the first along on the left hand side.ViewingStrictly by appointment through Warmingham

listing.description: This is certainly one of those properties that please your eye straight away with its picturesque chocolate box look. Located in Fordcombe which is described as A Beautiful Village In The Garden of England which we equally feel is certainly an apt description. Not every village these days has a village pub however Fordcombe has a lovely period public house that fits in nicely with the area, it's called the Chafford Arms and also has a restaurant and garden with views over the local farm and fields. The property is a grade two listed black and white detached cottage (hence the name) and has 4 to 5 first floor bedrooms as well as 4 ground floor reception rooms (including the conservatory) and has extensive gardens to the front side and rear. The side section of the garden extends back to the top of the lane which gives you some idea of how large this plot is. This impressive home is located in the delightful village of Fordcombe which is just outside the historic Kent County of Royal Tunbridge Wells. This property is located in a private country lane and backs directly onto farmland. From just standing outside and looking up to the property you get a feel that this is something special. And once you are inside you will appreciate the space and character that is featured throughout which includes beams to various wall and ceilings as well as an impressive main reception room with a large inglenook fireplace and vaulted beamed ceiling. When we walked around this ourselves it is noticeable that there is a need for updating and modernisation to various parts of this home which has been reflected in the asking price. The kitchen has a large fitted pine dresser and also a large useful pantry as well as a further deep cupboard where the gas central heating boiler is located. The conservatory opens out to the rear garden and has views to the extensive side part of the garden. From the kitchen you can access the dining room and a further lounge with fireplace. This opens into the front hallway which in turn then has access to the principle reception room which has a staircase leading up to an atrium and the master bedroom suite that includes a dressing room and a bathroom. We could carry on with the list of features but we are sure you will want to see this for yourself when carry out your own viewing which we of course do recommend you book early as we do expect a lot of interest in this very exclusive property. Fordcombe as we have said is an attractive village yet is only around 4 miles from Tunbridge Wells and 3 miles from Penshurst. Eastbourne is around 35 miles away. Within this area are many places of interest to visit as well as the main historic Kent Town of Royal Tunbridge Wells with the impressive Pantiles area. Reeds Rains are joint sole selling agents with Bardens of Tunbridge Wells.Entrance HallCharacter original entrance door into a square entrance hall. Fireplace. Doors opening into a reception lounge and door into the formal beamed character lounge.Living Room (4.80m x 5.64m)A very impressive room with a vaulted beamed ceiling and stairs to a mezzanine with access to the first floor main bedroom. Bathroom and dressing room. The main feature of the room is the large inglenook fireplace and as well as the beamed ceiling, walls and the tall leaded windows allowing good natural light. There is a door to the front and further windows to side and rear. If you are looking for a formal lounge that isDrawing Room (3.40m x 5.05m)Accessed from the formal entrance hall. Can be used as a second lounge. Leaded window to front. Beamed ceiling with also a beam across the brick fireplace.Dining Room (2.97m x 5.05m)Window to front aspect. Beamed walls and with step up to drawing room.Side PorchPart leaded entrance Door into side porch and further solid wood door into the kitchen.Kitchen (6.58m (max) x 3.38m)Fitted Pine dresser with shelving and drawers to one wall. Stainless steel sink unit with cupboards under. Sealed square leaded windows to side and rear with view over the side garden elevation. Double radiator, deep walk in cupboard which also includes the gas central heating boiler. Large very useful walk in pantry.Pantry (1.24m x 3.18m)Accessed directly from the kitchen and providing ample storage area.Conservatory (4.01m x 4.06m)Glazed on all sides with views over the garden and also doors opening out onto the terrace and patio.Cloakroom / WCLow level wcMezzanine (2.34m x 5.31m)Staircase from the principle lounge which provides an elevated view over the lounge and the character of the room.Master Bathroom (1.55m x 2.82m)White suite comprising bath, wash hand basin in vanity unit and low flush wc. Beamed walls.Master Bedroom (3.45m x 5.08m)High beamed ceiling. Double aspect windows. Fitted carpet.Dressing Room (1.96m x 2.49m)Window to front. Radiator and a range of fitted wardrobes.Bedroom 2 (2.62m x 3.53m)Beamed ceiling and walls, Window to front elevation.Bedroom 3 (3.38m (max) x 3.3m)Two sets of sealed double glazed windows overlooking the extensive rear garden. Plumbed in wash hand basin.Bedroom 4 (2.59m x 2.82m)Dual aspect windows to front and side. Beams to one wall. Plumbed in wash hand basin.Family Bathroom (1.88m x 1.98m)Panelled bath, low flush wc and wash hand basin. Diamond leaded window to rear.GardensThis is a major feature of the property as there are extensive gardens and land to the front side and rear. Whilst this has been maintained there is of course scope for new planting. The rear aspect is not overlooked and backs directly onto farmland. There is an abundance of shrubs and general planting as well as bushes and trees. A walkway runs around the grounds albeit it is a overgrown in certain places. A lot of bird life as well as pheasants was noticed on our visit. It would be an amazing garden for children and adults for garden parties and the like. There is a swimming pool in one corner of the garden which does require attention..External Swimming PoolGood size secluded swimming pool. Is in need of some work to get up to standard.Double Garage (5.44m x 4.34m)With sliding doors. And a tiled roof. Hard standing space for several cars.Important note to purchasers:We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller./8
